title: TextBlock should not be sealed
body: Sealed classes fly in the face of OOD, so there should be an incontrovertible reason for making a class sealed.  I don't accept the rational that sealing the class makes it perform better.  If you don't want the performance hit of virtual methods, then don't make them virtual.  There's no justification for sealing the entire class.

comments.body: Classes are sealed in WinRT because of the JavaScript/Html support, this was not about performance considerations. JavaScript does not know inheritance, and allowing it would have potentially caused problems when creating apps with JS. That is the reason why almost all classes are sealed, and why you cannot even create public WinRT classes as unsealed yourself.

There's a great discussion on the subject here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2134/do-sealed-classes-really-offer-performance-benefits. The community has looked at the subject, found no benefit to sealed classes and generally agrees that it corrupts the intent of OOD.
